title: What is the scope of cloud computing in India for freshers? - Quora

response.answer_text: Cloud Computing this technology is welcomed by many organisation in India and they even hire people for the role of Cloud Support Engineer, Cloud computing Engineer, Cloud Solution Engineer, Cloud Administrator/ Architect, etc. But what I personally came to experience that few organisation doesn't allow freshers for Cloud related jobs they expect experienced candidates. And the reason for the same can be the teaching pattern, we are not taught what is required in the present world and thus the recruiters moves towards experience holder because they don’t want to spend much time and money in the training of candidates itself, where they can easily get their work done by experienced candidates. But, Everyone was a fresher first, even the core industry now, where once just a startup. A fresher understands the pain of a fresher. The world is changing and thus, there are few organisation which are ready to test the freshers capability now-a-days so, don’t loose hope. Learn the concepts with practical knowledge, have some programming as well as scripting knowledge (powershell, python) and have your basics clear. Do such courses from institutions which fulfils the industry demands (Certifications will be an add-on). Cloud Computing is a fast growing technology and will hopefully bring opportunities for freshers. Best of Luck.

“Service at a click” that is what cloud is all about. Today almost everything is available on cloud. One of the most basic example that even you are using cloud services is when you created your first Gmail account in the last decade. Cloud, IOT are necessity for the exponential growth that the industry is going through. As a fresher, if you target cloud computing then it is a very good move. It might take a while to get there; however small steps in the right direction will eventually lead you to something good. As on today, there are numerous companies that offer cloud based products and services. You can do some research and target some companies which are offering such services. Internet of things is also a very lucrative area which is growing exponentially. As a fresher you would want to learn things that will assist you in growing in the cloud arena. Any good company will ask you about a valid and buyable explanation for the gap of two years. If you are able to convince them and sell your skills, then I think you might have a good chance of success.
